subject: Attention Unicode pundits: Half-letters etc. in Unicode
msgSnippet: Technically Unicode allows the insertion of invisible characters to enforce or prevent joining at any given point, but if I understand there must be a default
messageBody:
Technically Unicode allows the insertion of invisible
characters to enforce or prevent joining at any given point,
but if I understand there must be a default of either
joining or disjoining for any given script. Are there
markers to indicate that joining should or should not take
place in a given stretch of text rather than at a particular
point in a text? Can joining or disjoining be set on a font
basis and thus display with half-letters and alternate
letter forms be left to the discretion of the *reader*?
That would probably be ideal.

/BP 8^)>
--
Benct Philip Jonsson -- melroch atte melroch dotte se

if grammarians discuss them.
-Dr. Samuel Johnson (1707 - 1784)
